update.description:
Smaller PR from [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/144/a-5-add-magnetometer-and-imu-sensors/diff).  
 Includes a magnetometer sensor with its test

This follows [Ian’s altimeter approach](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/?state=MERGED) and it is strongly based on that PR. I think we should move later this sensors into ign-sensors but we decided that can be discussed after Acropolis release.

Also it is worth considering the [discussion](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/1294/inclusion-of-magnetic-field-strength) that included the magnetometer the first time. There is a lot of room for improvements.
update.title: [A-5] Add magnetometer sensor

content.raw: Thanks, let's just wait for all CI to come back happy before merging.
content.html: Thanks, let's just wait for all CI to come back happy before merging.

content.raw: Yes, I forgot to do it, doing it right now.
content.html: Yes, I forgot to do it, doing it right now.

content.raw: See pull request #171 for some suggestions and addressing some of my previous comments.
content.html: See pull request #171 for some suggestions and addressing some of my previous comments.

content.raw: How about setting a custom `<magnetic_field>` in the test world and checking in the test that the value is correctly propagated?
content.html: How about setting a custom <magnetic_field> in the test world and checking in the test that the value is correctly propagated?

content.raw: I recommend hardcoding the expected result here instead of repeating the math from the system. This would allow us to catch problems with the calculation itself.
content.html: I recommend hardcoding the expected result here instead of repeating the math from the system. This would allow us to catch problems with the calculation itself.

content.raw:
We're assuming that the magnetic field is the same all over the world, and given that all sensors handled by this system belong to the same world, I think we could avoid duplication and store the field in the system instead of in every sensor.

Another alternative is not to assume the field is fixed throughout the simulation and to query it every iteration (in the future the ECM will have functions to query only for components that changed).
content.html:
We're assuming that the magnetic field is the same all over the world, and given that all sensors handled by this system belong to the same world, I think we could avoid duplication and store the field in the system instead of in every sensor.

Another alternative is not to assume the field is fixed throughout the simulation and to query it every iteration (in the future the ECM will have functions to query only for components that changed).

content.raw: I think we don't need to store the world entity if we will only use it here
content.html: I think we don't need to store the world entity if we will only use it here

content.raw: yes, no problem. I was leaving it just to be consistent with the other sensors
content.html: yes, no problem. I was leaving it just to be consistent with the other sensors

content.raw: `sensorName` is never used, right? Can we remove it?
content.html: sensorName is never used, right? Can we remove it?

content.raw: I think this is not necessary, I believe that the physics engine will ignore this field.
content.html: I think this is not necessary, I believe that the physics engine will ignore this field.
